Document.Name: Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)

Usage.Content: Your financial aid awards are not official because you were selected for Verification. These estimated, conditional awards will not pay to your CARS account. You must complete the Verification documents and submit them to the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office with the required documentation. If your verified household or financial information varies significantly from what you reported on your FAFSA, your awards are subject to change from your conditional offer. The verification documents will be mailed to your permanent address.

You must verify your eligible non-citizen status by submitting the Eligible Non-Citizen Statement form with documentation. This documentation must be submitted, in person, to the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office.

The Department of Education could not confirm that you are registered with Selective Service. We must verify that you are registered, or are not required to register, before we can award you financial aid. You can register or confirm your registration on the Selective Service website at http://www.sss.gov/ or by calling 888-655-1825. Once you have documentation of your registration status, submit it with the Selective Service Verification form.

Your Social Security number did not match the information on file with the Social Security Administration. You must submit the Social Security Number Certification form to the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office in order to receive financial aid.

Your citizenship status could not be confirmed by the Social Security Administration. You must complete the U.S. Citizenship Certification and bring it, along with the required documentation, to the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office at 211 Sproul Hall. This form must be presented in person.

We were notified that you updated your FAFSA with new information that resulted in a change to your dependency status. You must complete the FAFSA Dependency Change form and submit the requested documentation to the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office.

We were notified that you updated your FAFSA with new information that resulted in a change to your Expected Family Contribution (EFC). You must complete the FAFSA Income or Asset Change form and submit the requested documentation to the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office.

We were notified that you updated your FAFSA with information that resulted in a change to your (or your parents') household size, number in college, and/or marital status. You must complete the FAFSA Household Information Change form and submit the requested documentation to the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office.

Award.LongDescription: Federal Work-Study Off Campus Non Profi
Federal Parent PLUS Loan 1 Pay to Parent

Diagnostic.Message: Admission Process Incomplete (transcript received, not reviewed)

Usage.Content: The Admissions Office has received, but not yet completed the review of your high school transcript. This review must be completed and your high school graduation, or equivalent, verified before you can receive any federal aid. Contact the Admissions Office to resolve this matter.

Diagnostic.Message: Cal Grant G-6 Certification Form Required

Usage.Content: To confirm your eligibility and receive your Transfer Entitlement Cal Grant award, you need to submit a completed Transfer Entitlement Cal Grant Certification Form (Form G-6) to the California Student Aid Commission (CSAC). You can complete the G-6 Form by logging on to WebGrants4Students at https://mygrantinfo.csac.ca.gov. In about 7 to 15 days after CSAC has processed your G-6 Form, this message will disappear, your Cal Grant hold will be released, and your Cal Grant funds will be disbursed.

Diagnostic.Message: Units less than half-time for spring - Cal Grant

Usage.Content: Your Cal Grant cannot pay until you are enrolled at least half-time for the spring semester.

Diagnostic.Message: Units less than half-time for fall - DL

Usage.Content: Your Direct Loan will not pay until you are enrolled at least half-time for the fall semester.

You are eligible for the Berkeley Middle Class Access Plan (MCAP). Your Federal Parent Contribution is already lower than the MCAP limit of 15% of your total income, and your awards reflect this best option. To learn more about the Berkeley Middle Class Access Plan, please follow the link to the right.
